column4: I'm trying to set up vbox @ ubuntu serwer with no graphical GUI. And till now I can run the vm and take PNG snapshot of its screen. but I can not connect to it in any way :/
do you have installed extpack ?
I mean from oracle site VirtualBox 4.1 Oracle VM VirtualBox Extension Pack
It isn't vbox guest addition it is an extpack that enable VRDE on server
If you want use ssh only, why you need RDP enabled?
So this might be the case.
well if you want it, install extpack before, and after run you guest machine VBoxHeadless --startvm 'name' then you can connect from another client with rdesktop-vrdp ip_server:3389
what is the package name of this extpack? I can not see anything I would suspect to be this.
http://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads
wget it in your server and install it by VBoxManage
and that is what I did: sudo apt-get install virtualbox-4.1 dkms
is it installed?
ok and do you have created guest machine in your server?
via *.ova?? what is that? maybe .vdi??
I use bridged networking so I needed to vboxmanage modifyvm name --bridgeadapter1 eth0 .
It doesn'n matter
you must create a guest machine on the server too, and after attach to it your *.vdi  HD
when I chose file -> export apilance at my desktop vm host I can chose betwean ova and ovf export formats
ok RDP doesn't run in that format at all
Ok so I'll try to make it at the server from strach :] ...anyway I thoght creating this et desktop woyld be more user frendly ;]
clone your .vdi with VBoxManage clonehd /path/*.vdi  /pendrive/*vdi  copy it in the same way into your server, create a new machine, attach .vdi
yeah, isn't more userfriendly use vbox without GUI :)
I'm learning more about it in this period of my worklife!! and it is awesome :p
